Light.description: A lighter design. Should be used in combination with the Standard header type.
Light.helpDescription: A lighter design. Should be used in combination with the Standard header type.

Crystal.description: An even lighter design. It borrows most of its properties from the Light design and just changes a few details like the header colors in order to have a blue design within gold reflection.
Crystal.helpDescription: An even lighter design. It borrows most of its properties from the Light design and just changes a few details like the header colors in order to have a blue design within gold reflection.

BrandOnly.description: Only the branding area is visible. Top-level navigation bar, header items, title and icon are not shown.

SlimNavigation.description: Like the Standard Area but with a leaner top-level navigation bar.
SlimNavigation.helpDescription: Like the Standard Area but with a leaner top-level navigation bar.

NoNavigation.description: Like the Standard Area but without top-level navigation bar.
NoNavigation.helpDescription: Like the Standard Area but without top-level navigation bar.

Fixed.description: The FacetFilter always has as many items in the FacetFilterList as defined in the visibleItemCount property.

Horizontal.helpDescription: The header content is displayed horizontally above the facet content

sap.ui.ux3.Feed.description: A container control representing a full feed page, including feeder and updates.
sap.ui.ux3.Feed.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Feed. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getFeederThumbnailSrc feederThumbnailSrc} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getFeederSender feederSender} : string
    • {@link #getLive live} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFilterItems filterItems} : sap.ui.core.ListItem[]
    • {@link #getChunks chunks} : sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk[]
    • {@link #getToolsMenuItems toolsMenuItems} : sap.ui.commons.MenuItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:filterChange filterChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:chunkAdded chunkAdded} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:toolsItemSelected toolsItemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:toggleLive toggleLive} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.QuickView.description: QuickView is a small popup with a short overview of a Thing. QuickView is shown when a user holds the mouse pointer over a related screen element.
sap.ui.ux3.QuickView.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new QuickView. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getType type} : string
    • {@link #getFirstTitle firstTitle} : string
    • {@link #getFirstTitleHref firstTitleHref} : string
    • {@link #getSecondTitle secondTitle} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getShowActionBar showActionBar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFollowState followState} : sap.ui.ux3.FollowActionState (default: Default)
    • {@link #getFlagState flagState} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFavoriteState favoriteState} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFavoriteActionEnabled favoriteActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUpdateActionEnabled updateActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFollowActionEnabled followActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFlagActionEnabled flagActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getOpenActionEnabled openActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Element[]
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingAction[]
    • {@link #getActionBar actionBar} : sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:actionSelected actionSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:feedSubmit feedSubmit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigate navigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase#constructor sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.ux3.QuickView.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.QuickView control.

sap.ui.ux3.Overlay.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Overlay. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getOpenButtonVisible openButtonVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getCloseButtonVisible closeButtonVisible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:close close} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:closed closed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:openNew openNew} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:open open} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.ux3.FacetFilterList.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FacetFilterList. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getMultiSelect multiSelect} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDisplaySecondaryValues displaySecondaryValues} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSelectedKeys selectedKeys} : string[]
    • {@link #getShowCounter showCounter} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.core.ListItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

defaultButton.description: Defines one of the buttons that have been provided via button aggregation to be the default button. This default button is initially selected, if no control is set via the initialFocus association explicitly. The default button is activated when Enter is pressed in the context of the dialog and when the currently selected element does not handle the Enter event itself.
defaultButton.helpDescription: Defines one of the buttons that have been provided via button aggregation to be the default button. This default button is initially selected, if no control is set via the initialFocus association explicitly. The default button is activated when Enter is pressed in the context of the dialog and when the currently selected element does not handle the Enter event itself.

sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup.description: A popup which the user can open from the Shell's tool pane. Generally, the starting point would be an icon. For this pop up, buttons can be defined with any text; therefore, it has the same purpose and similar look like any common dialog box. A ToolPopup can have any content. Depending on the application type and design, the structure of the texts and input fields can be for example form-like.
sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ToolPopup. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIconHover iconHover} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIconSelected iconSelected} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getModal modal} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getInverted inverted} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAutoClose autoClose} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMaxHeight maxHeight} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMaxWidth maxWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getOpenDuration openDuration} : int (default: 400)
    • {@link #getCloseDuration closeDuration} : int (default: 400)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getButtons buttons} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getInitialFocus initialFocus} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
    • {@link #getOpener opener} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
    • {@link #getDefaultButton defaultButton} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events

sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Popover control.
A popup which the user can open from the Shell's tool pane. Generally, the starting point would be an icon. For this pop up, buttons can be defined with any text; therefore, it has the same purpose and similar look like any common dialog box. A ToolPopup can have any content. Depending on the application type and design, the structure of the texts and input fields can be for example form-like.

DeprecatedInfo.description: Instead, use the sap.m.Popover control.

sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser.description: Attribute browse area used within the Exact pattern. The main benefit of this control is the high flexibility when large data amounts shall be displayed in the form of structured data sets with a high or low interdependency level. From lists - which can be nested according to the defined attributes - the user can choose entries and thereby trigger the display of further information, depending on the chosen entry/entries (multiple selection supported).
sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ExactBrowser. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getHeaderTitle headerTitle} : string
    • {@link #getTopListOrder topListOrder} : sap.ui.ux3.ExactOrder (default: Select)
    • {@link #getEnableListClose enableListClose} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getListHeight listHeight} : int (default: 290)
    • {@link #getShowHeader showHeader} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowTopList showTopList} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableReset enableReset} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableSave enableSave} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTopListWidth topListWidth} : int (default: 168)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAttributes attributes} : sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute[] (default)
    • {@link #getOptionsMenu optionsMenu} : sap.ui.commons.Menu
  • Associations
    • {@link #getFollowUpControl followUpControl} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:attributeSelected attributeSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:save save} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

The main benefit of this control is the high flexibility when large data amounts shall be displayed in the form of structured data sets with a high or low interdependency level. From lists - which can be nested according to the defined attributes - the user can choose entries and thereby trigger the display of further information, depending on the chosen entry/entries (multiple selection supported).

sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar.description:
A special toolbar with predefined social actions which can be shown as needed. These are: Create an update (Feed), Follow, Mark for Follow Up, Mark as Favorite and Open Thing.

In addition business actions (ThingAction instances) can be added which are either displayed as MenuItems of the 'More' menu button or as individual tool bar buttons.

When using this control, please be aware that it fulfills rather specific requirements: it has been designed for and is used within composite controls QuickView and ThingInspector.
sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ActionBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getFollowState followState} : sap.ui.ux3.FollowActionState (default: Default)
    • {@link #getFlagState flagState} : boolean
    • {@link #getFavoriteState favoriteState} : boolean
    • {@link #getUpdateState updateState} : boolean
    • {@link #getThingIconURI thingIconURI} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getAlwaysShowMoreMenu alwaysShowMoreMenu} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowUpdate showUpdate} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFollow showFollow} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFlag showFlag} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFavorite showFavorite} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowOpen showOpen} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDividerWidth dividerWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getBusinessActions businessActions} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingAction[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:actionSelected actionSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:feedSubmit feedSubmit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Toolbar or sap.m.OverflowToolbar control.
A special toolbar with predefined social actions which can be shown as needed. These are: Create an update (Feed), Follow, Mark for Follow Up, Mark as Favorite and Open Thing. In addition business actions (ThingAction instances) can be added which are either displayed as MenuItems of the 'More' menu button or as individual tool bar buttons. When using this control, please be aware that it fulfills rather specific requirements: it has been designed for and is used within composite controls QuickView and ThingInspector.

Fired when any of the social action’s toolbar buttons except ‘Update’ or any of the business action’s menu items resp. buttons is pressed. The selected action can be identified by its id and newState (the latter if applicable only) ‘Follow’ button + menu: id: follow, newState: Follow/Hold/Default ‘Mark for follow up’ button: id: flag, newState: true/false ‘Favorite’ button: id: favorite, newState: true/false ‘Open Thing Inspector’ button id: open Business Actions: id: the ThingAction id

For ‘Update’, please refer to event ‘feedSubmit’

href.description: Defines the link target URL. This property is optional and should only be set when required! The use of the href property is to not only allow users to navigate in-place by left-clicking NavigationItems, but also to allow right-click and then "open in new tab" or "open in new window". As long as href is not set, an empty window will open and stay blank. But when href is set, the new window/tab will load this URL and it is the application's responsibility to display what the user expects (e.g. the Shell, with the respective NavigationItem being selected).

  • Events
    • {@link #event:collectionSelected collectionSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:itemSelectionChanged itemSelectionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:editCollection editCollection} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.ux3.DataSetItem[]
    • {@link #getViews views} : sap.ui.ux3.DataSetView[]
    • {@link #getFilter filter} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedView selectedView} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.ux3.DataSetView)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectionChanged selectionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

selectedWorksetItem.description: The ID of the Item that is currently selected. When setting, the NavigationItem itself can be given instead of its ID. There will not be a worksetItemSelected event, the application is responsible to show the proper content according to the newly selected WorksetItem. If the set WorksetItem does not exist in this Shell, the first item (and first sub-item) will be selected after the call. When getting, always the ID is returned, by which the NavigationItem instance can be retrieved.

sap.ui.ux3.Shell.description: The Ux3 GoldReflection Shell, which is an application frame with navigation capabilities. It is supposed to be added to a direct child of the BODY tag of a page and there should be no other parts of the page consuming space outside the Shell.
sap.ui.ux3.Shell.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Shell. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getAppTitle appTitle} : string
    • {@link #getAppIcon appIcon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getAppIconTooltip appIconTooltip} : string
    • {@link #getShowLogoutButton showLogoutButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLogoutButtonTooltip logoutButtonTooltip} : string
    • {@link #getShowSearchTool showSearchTool} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowInspectorTool showInspectorTool} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowFeederTool showFeederTool} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowTools showTools} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowPane showPane} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeaderType headerType} : sap.ui.ux3.ShellHeaderType (default: Standard)
    • {@link #getDesignType designType} : sap.ui.ux3.ShellDesignType (default: Standard)
    • {@link #getPaneWidth paneWidth} : int (default: 250)
    • {@link #getApplyContentPadding applyContentPadding} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFullHeightContent fullHeightContent} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAllowOverlayHeaderAccess allowOverlayHeaderAccess} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getWorksetItems worksetItems} : sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem[]
    • {@link #getPaneBarItems paneBarItems} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
    • {@link #getPaneContent paneContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getToolPopups toolPopups} : sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup[]
    • {@link #getHeaderItems headerItems} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getNotificationBar notificationBar} : sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedWorksetItem selectedWorksetItem} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:worksetItemSelected worksetItemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:paneBarItemSelected paneBarItemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:logout logout} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:feedSubmit feedSubmit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:paneClosed paneClosed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.ThingInspector.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ThingInspector. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getFirstTitle firstTitle} : string
    • {@link #getType type} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getSecondTitle secondTitle} : string
    • {@link #getFollowState followState} : sap.ui.ux3.FollowActionState (default: Default)
    • {@link #getFlagState flagState} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFavoriteState favoriteState} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFavoriteActionEnabled favoriteActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUpdateActionEnabled updateActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFollowActionEnabled followActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFlagActionEnabled flagActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeaderType headerType} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewerHeaderType (default: Standard)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingAction[]
    • {@link #getHeaderContent headerContent} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingGroup[]
    • {@link #getFacets facets} : sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem[]
    • {@link #getFacetContent facetContent} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingGroup[]
    • {@link #getActionBar actionBar} : sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedFacet selectedFacet} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:actionSelected actionSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:facetSelected facetSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:feedSubmit feedSubmit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.ux3.Overlay#constructor sap.ui.ux3.Overlay} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar.description: A NotificationBar is a "toolbar" that can be added to a page to show messages and notifications from the application. Its position, height and width is inherited from the element that the notification bar is added to. The NotificationBar uses position: fixed; to always stay at the bottom of the screen. This CSS may sometimes cause issues when nested deeply inside other controls. To have a proper behavior of the NotificationBar use it as high in the control hierarchy as possible.
sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new NotificationBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getVisibleStatus visibleStatus} : sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBarStatus (default: Default)
    • {@link #getResizeEnabled resizeEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAlwaysShowToggler alwaysShowToggler} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getMessageNotifier messageNotifier} : sap.ui.core.Element
    • {@link #getNotifiers notifiers} : sap.ui.core.Element[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:display display} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:resize resize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.MessagePopover control.
A NotificationBar is a "toolbar" that can be added to a page to show messages and notifications from the application. Its position, height and width is inherited from the element that the notification bar is added to. The NotificationBar uses position: fixed; to always stay at the bottom of the screen. This CSS may sometimes cause issues when nested deeply inside other controls. To have a proper behavior of the NotificationBar use it as high in the control hierarchy as possible.

DeprecatedInfo.description: Instead, use the sap.m.MessagePopover control.

sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewer.description: ThingViewer: Same as ThingInspector but decoupled from the Overlay and the ActionBar. The control can be added to a Parent container that has a defined width. The ThingViewer fill the whole container. If the parent container has no width defined the control will not work properly.
sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ThingViewer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getType type} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getSubtitle subtitle} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeaderType headerType} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewerHeaderType (default: Standard)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getHeaderContent headerContent} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingGroup[]
    • {@link #getFacets facets} : sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem[]
    • {@link #getFacetContent facetContent} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingGroup[]
    • {@link #getActionBar actionBar} : sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedFacet selectedFacet} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:facetSelected facetSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewer.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 There is not an exact replacement.
ThingViewer: Same as ThingInspector but decoupled from the Overlay and the ActionBar. The control can be added to a Parent container that has a defined width. The ThingViewer fill the whole container. If the parent container has no width defined the control will not work properly.

DeprecatedInfo.description: There is not an exact replacement.

sap.ui.ux3.OverlayDialog.description: Dialog implementation based on the Overlay. If used in a Shell it leaves the Tool-Palette, Pane-Bar and Header-Items accessible.
sap.ui.ux3.OverlayDialog.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new OverlayDialog. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: auto)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: auto)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.ux3.Overlay#constructor sap.ui.ux3.Overlay} can be used as well.
sap.ui.ux3.OverlayDialog.helpDescription:

sap.ui.ux3.DataSetItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DataSetItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getIconSrc iconSrc} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: Title)
    • {@link #getCheckable checkable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSubtitle subtitle} : string (default: Subtitle)
  • Aggregations
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selected selected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute.description: An element for defining attributes and sub-attributes used within the Exact pattern.
sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ExactAttribute. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getSelected selected} : boolean
    • {@link #getWidth width} : int (default: 168)
    • {@link #getListOrder listOrder} : sap.ui.ux3.ExactOrder (default: Select)
    • {@link #getShowSubAttributesIndicator showSubAttributesIndicator} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAdditionalData additionalData} : object
    • {@link #getSupplyActive supplyActive} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAutoActivateSupply autoActivateSupply} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAttributes attributes} : sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:supplyAttributes supplyAttributes} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

showSubAttributesIndicator.description: Specifies whether the attribute shall have sub values for visual purposes. The indicator which is a little arrow beside an attribute in the list is computed automatically (getShowSubAttributesIndicator_Computed() of sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute). In the case that a supply function is attached, and the supplyActive attribute has value 'true', then the Exact pattern needs a hint if sub attributes are available. The showSubAttributesIndicator attribute is considered then and has to be maintained. If the back-end does not support count-calls, for example, showSubAttributesIndicator should be set to true.

sap.ui.ux3.DataSetSimpleView.description: DataSetSimpleView provides a simple view example for DataSet usage.
sap.ui.ux3.DataSetSimpleView.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DataSetSimpleView. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getFloating floating} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getName name} : string (default: Name of this View)
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIconHovered iconHovered} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIconSelected iconSelected} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getResponsive responsive} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getItemMinWidth itemMinWidth} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getInitialItemCount initialItemCount} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getReloadItemCount reloadItemCount} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getScrollArea scrollArea} : any
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTemplate template} : sap.ui.core.Control
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.ux3.DataSetSimpleView.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Use a layout by choice from the {@link sap.m} library, instead.
DataSetSimpleView provides a simple view example for DataSet usage.

sap.ui.ux3.Exact.description: A comprehensive UI design approach with graphical and functional elements for searching data, exploring data, and acting on the data ("Explore and Act (Exact) Pattern").
sap.ui.ux3.Exact.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Exact. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getResultText resultText} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSettingsMenu settingsMenu} : sap.ui.commons.Menu
    • {@link #getAttributes attributes} : sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:refineSearch refineSearch} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.Collection.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Collection. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMultiSelection multiSelection} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedItems selectedItems} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Item)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectionChanged selectionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:propertyChanged propertyChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk.description: The unit that is embedded - single-wise or in a multiple way - into a Feed control. The control provides a set of properties for text, sender information, time stamp, comments, and functions such as flagging the entry to be favorite, shared, or flagged.
sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FeedChunk. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getThumbnailSrc thumbnailSrc} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getSender sender} : string
    • {@link #getTimestamp timestamp} : string
    • {@link #getDeletionAllowed deletionAllowed} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getCommentChunk commentChunk} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFeederThumbnailSrc feederThumbnailSrc} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getFeederSender feederSender} : string
    • {@link #getFlagged flagged} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFavorite favorite} : boolean
    • {@link #getShared shared} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableFlag enableFlag} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableShare enableShare} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableComment enableComment} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableInspect enableInspect} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableFavorite enableFavorite} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getComments comments} : sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk[]
    • {@link #getActionMenuItems actionMenuItems} : sap.ui.commons.MenuItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:deleted deleted} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:commentAdded commentAdded} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:toggleFlagged toggleFlagged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:senderClicked senderClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:referenceClicked referenceClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:toggleFavorite toggleFavorite} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:inspect inspect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:toggleShared toggleShared} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:actionItemSelected actionItemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.FeedListItem control.
The unit that is embedded - single-wise or in a multiple way - into a Feed control. The control provides a set of properties for text, sender information, time stamp, comments, and functions such as flagging the entry to be favorite, shared, or flagged.

DeprecatedInfo.description: Instead, use the sap.m.FeedListItem control.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

commentChunk.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.4.0 Not longer used. If a chunk is a comment is determined from hierarchy. If the parent is a chunk it's automatically a comment.

sap.ui.ux3.ThingAction.description: Thing Action for Swatch, QuickView, Thinginspector
sap.ui.ux3.ThingAction.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ThingAction. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.NavigationBar.description: Provides enhanced navigation capabilities and is the parent control of NavigationItem. It is displayed in the form of a horizontal line with switching markers depending on the currently selected item. The size of an item which is currently chosen by the user is enlarged. In the case that a large number of items are defined for the bar, this is made transparent to the user by showing symbols for scrolling options (forwards and backwards) to see the next or previous items.
sap.ui.ux3.NavigationBar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new NavigationBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getToplevelVariant toplevelVariant} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getOverflowItemsToUpperCase overflowItemsToUpperCase} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedItem selectedItem} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem)
    • {@link #getAssociatedItems associatedItems} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.ux3.NavigationBar.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.IconTabBar, sap.m.TabContainer or sap.uxap.ObjectPageLayout control.
